You and Missy are both in Climate Change - I care!

About

Missy Lahren has worked as an activist and public interest lawyer in the San Francisco Bay Area since 1993. She has a Ph.D. in Philosophy and Religion and a M.Ed. in Integral Education, both of which focus on the emerging field of “ecozoic education.” She has been working to expand enforceable human and ecological rights since 1997 through participatory media and board positions at Earth Law Center, Unite for Rights, Planetary Advocates, and Eleanor Lives.

Missy Lahren reposted this

Earth Law Center

6,729 followers

2mo • 

🌿Earth Law Center ventured into the Peruvian Amazon to partner with Asháninka communities and key allies in protecting native stingless bees.

🤝Together with scientists and strategic allies like @amazonresearchint and @beesfordevelopment, we conducted community empowerment workshops and stingless bee mapping in Asháninka territory, with support from @sernanp and @rc.asháninka.

🐝Over two weeks, we engaged deeply with 50+ Asháninka community members, incorporating their traditional knowledge and feedback to develop initiatives that protect both their cultural heritage and native stingless bee populations.

🔎✨This collaborative effort bridges science and ancestral wisdom to protect Nature and Indigenous Rights. We're proud to share some highlights from this expedition with you.

💪💚This is just the beginning. Want to be part of the change? Support Earth Law Center's Latin America Legal Program via the link in our bio.

#bees #latam #climatechange #animalrights #nature #naturelovers #theamazon #amazonia

🐾 What if animals could take humans to court?
Join us for the premiere of this timeless fable brought to life on stage — a family-friendly performance where animals demand justice and remind us why their rights matter.

🎭 Followed by a fireside chat on ecocentrism in urban spaces.
🌿 Presented by Earth Law Center.

Don’t miss this unique mix of theater, activism, and inspiration.
📌 More info in our bio.


#RightsofNature #EarthLaw #ClimateWeekNYC #AnimalRights

The Green Amendment gives us the constitutional right to clean air, safe water, and a healthy environment. New York is one of only three states that has taken this landmark step. Join us at Climate Week NYC to learn how local governments can put this right into action and what it means for climate justice worldwide.

📍 Innovating with the New York Green Amendment
🗓 Tuesday, Sept. 23, 2025 | 11:00 AM – 12:00 PM

More details here: https://lnkd.in/gijWD6TU

#nyc #climateweek #nature #rightsofnature #rightsofanimals #naturelovers

11mo • 

It was such an honor to be at COP16 with this team! Each of your stories are so inspiring and I am very excited to help spread the word!

Grant Wilson 
 • 1st

Executive Director at Earth Law Center. We give Nature a voice in the legal system.

Visit my website

11mo • Edited • 

This is what happens when a group of Earth lawyers & advocates meet a river with rights, the Pance River in Colombia! 🌊 👩‍⚖️ 📸 

This was the funnest hour I can remember, seriously! All lawyers, judges, negotiators, and politicians should also find joy in Nature before making impactful decisions on the future of the environment. 

This field trip was a source of motivation as we advocated for the Rights of Nature and ecocentric law at #COP16. We also floated the idea of a formally recognized Nature Delegation to give a voice to the environment at future talks. 

🙏 Gratitude to Nikki Riddy for taking most of these pictures alongside Callie Veelenturf and The Leatherback Project! Thank you also to Paul Powlesland (Lawyers for Nature) for loaning me your necktie--the crucial element I forgot. The last photo is a sneak preview of a future post on COP16, where we shared a booth with Global Alliance for the Rights of Nature (GARN) and Stop Ecocide International and teamed up with many more. Full recap to come.

🎆 Incredible job by the Earth Law Center team, which worked VERY hard for two weeks to advocate for Nature's voice and rights. Including Samantha Gottsegen, Constanza Prieto Figelist, F. Javier Ruiz, Tory Dille, Annie Lalonde, Emily Zinkula, Felipe Clavijo-Ospina, Charlotte Dent, Karie Crisp, Missy Lahren, Patricia Welty, & Anne Solgaard. More pictures of that to follow.

1yr • Edited • 

Earth Law Center & friends are at EarthX! Join us April 22-26, in Dallas, #Texas, with three all-star panels. EarthX is one of the world’s premier environmental gatherings, bringing together diverse perspectives towards a common goal of protecting the planet. Come to hang out with ELC! BIG discounts below. 🤠 

📣 Here are the three panels: 

1) EARTH LAW: Legalizing the Rights and Voices of Nature  🌍 👬🏽 🐙 🐍 🏛

2) RELIGION, ECOLOGY AND LAW: We’re All in This Together 🌌 🌍 👬🏽

3) SHORT FILM: “Saving the Elwha River’s Forests” 🌲 🌊 📽 

Here is an EPIC code for a hugely discounted $99/day rate to share with my network: https://lnkd.in/gTcFX-yj ( ⭐ Code: EARTHXCOC24)

Full conference agenda (😍): https://lnkd.in/gbtfTjM7

I’ve never been to Texas although I feel like I live in “Little Texas” during the summers in Durango. I can’t wait to share Earth law with a new audience. Please come!!! As a bonus, you'll hear my Matthew McConaughey impression. 

Speakers include Grant Wilson, Kevin Schneider, Callie Veelenturf, Anthony Zelle, Pooja Sharma, Joanie Klar, Or Rose, Richard Cizik, Natalia Greene, Missy Lahren, Elizabeth D. & others!!

Please join me and an incredible panel of experts in NYC during Climate Week for an inspiring discussion about the role of 3 keystone marine species: Southern Resident Orcas, Leatherback sea turtles, and Hammerhead sharks. We’ll discuss their vital roles in protecting biodiversity and helping to mitigate climate change. Help me spread the word about this free event!

Missy Lahren 
 • 1st

Chair of Board of Directors @ Earth Law Center | Public Interest Lawyer, Producer, and Writer

2yr • 

https://lnkd.in/gAdKJnSy

Earth Law Center

6,729 followers

2yr • 

I am reaching out with an urgent request from Earth Law Center: We need to stop the systematic logging of “legacy forests” in the State of Washington. These trees are the age of our grandparents. We’ve identified a critical 126-acre stretch of forest called "Power Plant" that is slated for timber auction on July 26, 2023. We must delay and ultimately stop this sale; it’s scheduled to happen in just 2 days! 

“Power Plant” is a unique legacy forest case: Earth Law Center, et al. vs. DNR. Since its mature canopy and root system is located near the banks of the Elwha River, logging these old trees will impact stream flows, slope stability, and the salmon spawning in the river. Damage to the salmon triggers problems downstream for the critically endangered Southern Resident Orcas (73 left), who feed at the mouth of the river and rely on those very salmon to survive. 

Forty-five miles long, the iconic Elwha River flows from the headwaters in the Olympic National Park to the Strait of Juan de Fuca. The river received international attention when the federal government removed its two dams in 2014, allowing its waters to finally run free. Taxpayers paid $327 million to successfully restore the river, yet the State jeopardizes this progress by using outdated logging guidance and ignoring the reality of climate change and the rights of future generations.

On June 30, 2023, the Earth Law Center’s Elizabeth Dunne embarked on an emergency campaign to protect Power Plant and the remaining 800 acres of legacy forest around the Elwha. Power Plant’s unique facts and location may be just the catalyst to bring longer lasting protection to other critical forests in the Elwha Watershed, while also amplifying the urgent need to save legacy forests generally. This past Friday, Elizabeth and pro bono lawyer, Steven Turner, went to Court to try and delay the July sale. While the Court listened carefully to the arguments, the judge has yet to rule and the auction is still on the calendar – less than two days away. 

We are incredulous that the state government has chosen to log in a watershed that the federal government and local community has worked so hard to restore. As the iconic River regenerates, it inspires many – not only Washingtonians– but people all around the world that ecosystems can restore themselves. 

Our immediate need is to spread the word as widely as possible and to raise funds to protect the forest. We aim to purchase the extractive timber harvest lease– essentially "buying" the right to protect rather than extract. So, there's no reason to log. So please:

*Donate to the Elwha Forest Fund: https://lnkd.in/gWaCMi75
*Read & forward the story: https://lnkd.in/g7DQvzcy
*Donate to the Earth Law Center’s Elwha Forest Legal Team: https://lnkd.in/etfX7C9x

Since we are a 501(c)(3), your contribution will be tax deductible.

For more info: edunne@earthlawcenter.org, 808-554-1409

Many thanks!
